intro: Angostura ovata, commonly known as the oval angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
